Content:: Kidagalegama Hethuhamige Nandasena (born 20 September 1954) is a Sri Lankan politician, former provincial minister and Member of Parliament.[1] Nandasena was born on 20 September 1954.[1] He was a member of Padaviya Divisional Council and North Central Provincial Council where he held a provincial ministerial portfolio.[2] He was dismissed from his ministerial position in May 2017 after attending a Joint Opposition May Day rally.[3][4] He contested the 2020 parliamentary election as a Sri Lanka People's Freedom Alliance electoral alliance candidate in Anuradhapura District and was elected to the Parliament of Sri Lanka.[5][6][7]  This article about a politician from North Central Province, Sri Lanka is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
